messages.messageBody:
The American Homeschool Association Archives List

The new AHA-Archives list provides access to information files, links to
recommended websites, the Homeschool Writers Clearinghouse files, back
issues of the AHA Newsletter, and much more. This is not a discussion list;
this list is moderated and restricted to AHA uploads and announcements only.

You can join this list by going to the following web page:

http://www.onelist.com/subscribe.cgi/AHA-Archives

A digest version of this list is available. This list supports filesharing,
bookmarks, archives, and other services for listmembers. This is not a
discussion list; this list is moderated and restricted to AHA uploads and
announcements only.

A listing of what's currently available via this list:

Bookmarks:
American Homeschool Association website
Homeschool Support Groups Listing
State Laws and Regulations
National and International Organizations which support homeschooling
Information Files for New Homeschoolers
Homeschooling Resources and Information from the AHA
HEM's Homeschooling Information Library

Information Files:
AHA Index
What Is the AHA?

Newsletters:
May, 1999 newsletter

Homeschooling Writers Clearinghouse:
Dispelling The Myths About Homeschooling, by Christine Webb
Dealing With Our Doubts, by Alison McKee
"Reluctant" Homeschoolers, by Leslie Moyer
The Truth about Homeschooling and Socialization, by Lucinda H Kennaley
The HSLDA Question, by Mary McCarthy
Winter Homeschooling, by Helen Hegener
Crafting Ships, by Mark Hegener
Testing in the Real World, by Mark & Helen Hegener
On Jumping Through Hoops, by Helen Hegener
Homeschooling and the Media, by Martine Palmiter
Conversation is Learning Too!, by Beverley Paine
Introduction To Educating Your Children At Home, by Beverley Paine

For a complete Index of Free Online Services from the American Homeschool
Association send a message to AHA@... with the word Index
in the subject line of your message.

Mark and Helen Hegener, Directors
American Homeschool Association
AHA@...
http://www.home-ed-magazine.com/AHA/aha.html
